doc.field: Commentary on Giles of Corbeil's De urinis [Latin]
K. Sudhoff, 'Commentatoren der Harnverse des Gilles de Corbeil', Archeion: Archivio di storia della scienza 11 (1929), 129–135

eTK 0820G ('Liber iste nove institutionis studiose compositionis'), 0821I, 0821I*, 0821J ('Liber iste quem quem legendum proponimus est novelle [uel nouae] institutionis'), 0689G ('in libro isto ille auctor intendens'), 0422A, 1348G ('Renibus una dicitur quia formaliter generatur')

eTK 0820G ('Liber iste nove institutionis studiose compositionis'), 0821I, 0821I*, 0821J ('Liber iste quem quem legendum proponimus est novelle [uel nouae] institutionis'), 0689G ('in libro isto ille auctor intendens'), 0422A, 1348G ('Renibus una dicitur quia formaliter generatur')

The commentary printed in 1483 as by Gentile da Foligno and later comprises prologue ('Liber iste nove'), 'expositio', beginning 'In libro isto', and 'commentum', beginning 'Renibus una dicitur quia formaliter'). Choulant suggested that only the expositio was by Foligno, with the commentum (which circulates earlier) perhaps by Giles of Corbeil himself.

Commentary on Giles of Corbeil's De pulsibus [Latin]
Commentarium in De pulsibus Aegidii Corboliensis
The text printed in 1484 and later seems to be essentially the same commentary found in manuscripts from the thirteenth century and also attributed to Giles of Corbeil.
